title: Math ISA
content:
Hello everyone.

I have screwed up my Math ISA very badly due to time constraints. 

I would like to know from the seniors if all ISAs are gonna be like this.

What will they ask in EPD,chem, Mechanics and Python if anyone can please please tell.  
Also how did you manage time? I'm really teary eyed rn and looking for some helpful advice üôèüôè

comments.body: To add on, there's no failing in Isa's, is there? And if there is what are the consequences? Also is it relative or absolute grading?

Hey we had mcqs in math so the average in math use to be pretty high like I know people who did not study and get 19/20
But now that's not the case ,you really need to solve to get answers because of hybrid.
Also epd and other subject will be easy only if you have done notes/slides 
And
There's no failing in isa so chill .
oh okay thank you sir for the help

There is no failing in ISA. 

ISA is always absolute grading. ESA can be relative ONLY if the entire batch does badly.
Not always but it's not uncommon to have very hard ISAs
Its coz of the new 2 ISA system, even we had time constraint.. so do expect it for other ISA's too..
